title: A proclamation, published by the high and mightie Prince Elector Iohn Sigismond Marquesse of Brandenburgh, the foure and twentieth day of February anno 1614 Prohibiting all maner of scandalls and calumniations to be vsed by the clergie, in the pulpit or else-where, throughout his prouinces and dominions: commanding to preach only the true word of God to the edification of his subiects. Translated faithfully out of the high-Dutch coppy. By Mich. Vanderstegen.
author: Brandenburg (Electorate). Sovereign (1608-1619 : John Sigismund)
publisher: Printed [by N. Okes] for William Houlmes, and are to be sold at his shop in Popes-head Pallace,
notes: In the title page phrase "Translated faithfully out of the high-Dutch coppy" the "o" in the word "out" appears to be a "c".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
